info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 18 at 1:01PM CST until December 18 at 1:30PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CST FOR BEAUREGARD...NORTHWESTERN CALCASIEU...SOUTHWESTERN VERNON PARISHES IN WEST CENTRAL LOUISIANA AND SOUTHEASTERN NEWTON COUNTIES... At 101 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Junction to near Deweyville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Sulphur, De Ridder, Vinton, Rosepine, Merryville, Singer, Deweyville, Starks, Fields, Bon Weir, De Quincy, Longville, Lunita, Bivens, Buhler, Hartburg, Edgerly, Devils Pocket, Tulla and Bancroft. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
